On 2012/03/03 23:14:44, Kyle E. Lemons wrote: > bedtime? Done.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, kyle@kylelemons.net, r@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

http://codereview.appspot.com/5728055/diff/6001/doc/reference-cmd.html File doc/reference-cmd.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/5728055/diff/6001/doc/reference-cmd.html#newcode28 doc/reference-cmd.html:28: Fix finds Go programs that use old APIs and rewrites them to use newer ones. On 2012/03/04 23:36:51, r wrote: > can we avoid API? > old features of the language and libraries Done. http://codereview.appspot.com/5728055/diff/6001/doc/reference-cmd.html#newcode64 doc/reference-cmd.html:64: Yacc is a version of yacc for Go. On 2012/03/04 23:36:51, r wrote: > probably need to give a usage line: go, go fix, go tool yacc, etc. Done.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

LGTM http://codereview.appspot.com/5728055/diff/3001/doc/reference-cmd.html File doc/reference-cmd.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/5728055/diff/3001/doc/reference-cmd.html#newcode70 doc/reference-cmd.html:70: This is an abridged list. See the full command reference Is there any way to specify this as a list of ones (maybe with some kind of template magic) to include instead of manually duplicating it? If there's no existing way to do it, it is probably more work than the relatively small number of edits that will happen here, though. http://codereview.appspot.com/5728055/diff/3001/doc/reference.html File doc/reference.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/5728055/diff/3001/doc/reference.html#newcode8 doc/reference.html:8:

Good bedroom reading.

bedtime?

On 2012/03/05 03:31:07, r wrote: > maybe put this first, and say how all the others can be run from it. start > *here* Done.

http://codereview.appspot.com/5728055/diff/6001/doc/reference-cmd.html File doc/reference-cmd.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/5728055/diff/6001/doc/reference-cmd.html#newcode28 doc/reference-cmd.html:28: Fix finds Go programs that use old APIs and rewrites them to use newer ones. can we avoid API? old features of the language and libraries http://codereview.appspot.com/5728055/diff/6001/doc/reference-cmd.html#newcode64 doc/reference-cmd.html:64: Yacc is a version of yacc for Go. probably need to give a usage line: go, go fix, go tool yacc, etc.

https://codereview.appspot.com/5728055/diff/1026/doc/reference-cmd.html File doc/reference-cmd.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/5728055/diff/1026/doc/reference-cmd.html#newcode39 doc/reference-cmd.html:39: Go is a tool for managing Go source code. maybe put this first, and say how all the others can be run from it. start *here*

LGTM
